competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Energy cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Energy career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Energy career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Energy career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Energy career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Energy career cluster.
Research a career in the Energy career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Energy career cluster.
Explore careers and entry requirements in the energy industry.
Describe careers in the energy industry.
Explain educational pathways available to gain training to begin a career in the energy industry.
Classify careers from entry-level to professional level.
Explain the importance of employability skills related to the energy industry.
Research and present information on an energy career including roles and responsibilities, opportunities for employment and the requirements for education and training.
Explain how destructive decisions can affect future employment.
Locate power plants in Florida.
Describe the energy source(s) the power plants use.
Map the areas that are served by particular utility companies.
Describe different types of utility businesses (electric cooperatives, municipal, investor owned).
Investigate energy consumption and identify ways to use energy wisely.
Describe energy efficiency and conservation.
Read and interpret a residential utility bill.
Learn how to measure energy use of various equipment.
Learn how to measure light output.
Graph temperature and humidity levels in classrooms.
Identify ways to conserve energy at home and at school.
Plan ways to improve energy efficiency at home and at school.
Discuss greenhouse gas emissions based on local fuel mixture and energy consumption.
Discuss local fuel mixture.
Compare greenhouse gas emissions (carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxide, etc.) for various types of fuel (e.g. coal, petroleum, natural gas).
Explain the importance of fuel mix diversity.
Discuss sources of energy used by local utility.
Generation
Explore the generation pathway of the energy industry and the applicable career options.
Explain ways of generating electric power.
Define and use proper terminology associated with energy generation.
Describe some of the careers available in energy generation.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in energy generation.
Research the history of energy generation careers and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify education required to successfully enter any career in the energy generation field.
Describe career ladder options and the skills or education required to progress in the energy industry.
Describe technologies associated with careers in energy generation.
Explore various sources of renewable and nonrenewable energy generation and the careers associated with them.
Identify possibilities for future careers in energy that support emerging technologies.
Describe how society has impacted the energy industry.
Demonstrate employability skills and hands-on skills required to successfully enter any career in the energy generation field.
Understand conventional electric power generation.
Explain the conventional electric power generation systems and process (coal, petroleum, hydroelectric and nuclear).
Identify various conventional electric power generation fuel sources and the cost, efficiency or environmental advantages and disadvantages of each.
Diagram conventional electrical power generation systems.
Discuss the value of alternative and renewable energy sources.
Identify the reasons for seeking alternatives to fossil fuels to include economic, environmental and social impacts.
Understand the difference between alternative energy and renewable energy.
Understand the economic, environmental and social impact of alternative and renewable energy.
Compare and contrast alternative and renewable sources of energy with conventional sources of energy.
Investigate the viability of wind energy.
Describe the process to harness wind energy.
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages to wind technology.
Diagram a wind turbine.
Explain what makes a location appropriate for wind energy and identify on a map.
Investigate the viability of solar energy.
Describe solar energy and how it is harnessed.
Explain the difference between passive solar and active solar.
Diagram a solar cell.
Describe a central receiver system.
Diagram a solar thermal plant.
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using solar energy.
Explain what makes a location appropriate for solar energy and identify on a map.
Investigate the use of hydroelectricity.
Describe hydroelectric energy production.
Diagram a hydroelectric plant.
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using hydroelectricity energy.
Explain what makes a location appropriate for hydroelectricity and identify on a map.
Investigate the use of nuclear power.
Explain the process of nuclear fission.
Define radio-isotopes and half-life.
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of nuclear power.
Diagram a Light-Water Reactor (LWR) (e.g. control rods, coolant, containment vessel, dry casks, turbine, etc.).
Describe nuclear energy and how it is harnessed.
Discuss types of locations where building nuclear power plants would not be feasible.
Investigate the viability of bioenergy (biomass and biofuel).
Discuss the major sources of biomass.
Define biofuels (e.g. ethanol, biodiesel and methanol).
Outline the pyramid energy flow including the different trophic levels.
Describe the major sources, scale and impacts of biomass energy.
Diagram an electric energy producing biomass plant.
List the advantages and disadvantages of using biomass for energy (e.g. CO2 emissions, photosynthetic efficiency, cost, etc.).
Research and map appropriate locations ideal for biomass and biofuel applications.
Investigate the viability of geothermal energy.
Describe geothermal energy and the way it is harnessed.
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using geothermal energy.
Diagram a geothermal power plant.
Explain what makes a location appropriate for a geothermal energy power plant and identify on a map.
Transmission/Distribution
Explore the transmission/distribution pathway of the energy industry and the applicable career option.
Define and use proper terminology associated with energy transmission/distribution.
Describe some of the careers available in energy transmission/distribution.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in energy transmission/distribution.
Research the history of energy transmission/distribution and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in energy transmission/distribution.
Describe common career ladders in energy transmission/distribution.
Describe technologies associated with careers in energy transmission/distribution.
Demonstrate employability skills and hands-on skills required to successfully enter any career in the energy transmission/distribution field.
Understand electric power transmission and distribution.
Explain the electric power transmission process.
Understand the differences between AC and DC power.
Explain the electric power distribution process.
Discuss the need for electric distribution systems and how they are designed to operate.
Discuss the emerging technologies in electric power transmission and distribution.
